metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20922 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Handlebars before 4.4.5 allows Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) because of eager matching. The parser may be forced into an endless loop while processing crafted templates. This may allow attackers to exhaust system resources.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

handlebars - 3:4.7.2-1
libjs-handlebars - 3:4.7.2-1
libjs-handlebars.runtime - 3:4.7.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-handlebars package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3:4.7.2-1').
